thread.title: ASX is up but this freelancing marketplace climbed 12.9%
thread.title_full: ASX is up but this freelancing marketplace climbed 12.9% | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: ASX is up but this freelancing marketplace climbed 12.9%
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)Australian stocks have built on yesterday’s gains with the All Ords rising 43.5 points or 0.8% to 5653.1.

Resources stocks were amongst the biggest gainers with the Energy Index rising 2.2% to 10996.4 points.

Oil Search ( ASX:OSH ) is up 2.2% to 7.47 Santos ( ASX:STO ) gained 4.2% to 7.43 and Woodside Petroleum ( ASX:WPL ) climbed 2.0% to 35.65.

Market Action here 

Freelancer ( ASX:FLN ASX:FLN ASX:FLN/strong> rose 12.9% to 1.49 with 1.1 million shares traded after posting a 41% increase in headline net revenue to 16.8 million for the half-year ended 30th June 2015.

This was driven by strong organic growth with no major acquisitions.

The company had positive operating cashflow of 1.1 million for the period.

As at 30th June 2015 the company held cash and equivalents of a healthy 31.1 million up 54% on the previous period.

It also saw the number of users increase to 16 million.

Latin Resources ( ASX:LRS ) jumped 33.3% to 0.08 with more than 2 million shares.

Yesterday the company’s joint exploration initiative with First Quantum Minerals (TSE:FM) resulted in the discovery of a new porphyry copper target in Southern Peru.

First Quantum is capitalised at C7.5 billion and has seven operating mines globally.

The 5 kilometre circular feature was uncovered in aeromagnetic data with Andean and cross arc structures intersecting the area.

Notably this area of the Southern Peru copper belt is completely covered by recent sediments indicating that prior exploration was ineffective.

Metro Mining ( ASX:MMI ) is up 20% to 0.09 while OncoSil Medical ( ASX:OSL ) climbed 13% to 0.13 with 6.5 million shares traded.
